### STATEMENT

SELECT n.id, n.service_name, s.id AS subscription_id, s.subscription_type, sp.provider_name AS provider_name FROM NetworkConfigurations n JOIN Subscriptions s ON n.id = s.provider_id JOIN ServiceProviders sp ON s.provider_id = sp.id;

SELECT n.service_name, AVG(length(s.subscription_type)) AS avg_subscription_length FROM NetworkConfigurations n JOIN Subscriptions s ON n.id = s.provider_id GROUP BY n.service_name;

### STATEMENT

SELECT p.provider_name, COUNT(d.id) AS device_count, AVG(length(n.service_name)) AS avg_service_name_length FROM ServiceProviders p JOIN Devices d ON p.id = d.provider_id JOIN NetworkConfigurations n ON d.provider_id = n.id GROUP BY p.provider_name;

CREATE TABLE NetworkConfigurations ( 
    id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    service_name VARCHAR(50), 
    ip_address VARCHAR(15), 
    subnet_mask VARCHAR(15), 
    gateway_address VARCHAR(15) 
);

CREATE TABLE ServiceProviders ( 
    id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    provider_name VARCHAR(50) 
);

CREATE TABLE Subscriptions ( 
    id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    subscription_type VARCHAR(50), 
    start_date DATE, 
    end_date DATE, 
    provider_id INT, 
    FOREIGN KEY (provider_id) REFERENCES ServiceProviders(id) 
);

CREATE TABLE Devices ( 
    id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    device_name VARCHAR(50), 
    device_type VARCHAR(50), 
    status VARCHAR(20), 
    provider_id INT, 
    FOREIGN KEY (provider_id) REFERENCES ServiceProviders(id) 
);

CREATE TABLE Policies ( 
    id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    policy_name VARCHAR(50), 
    description TEXT, 
    provider_id INT, 
    FOREIGN KEY (provider_id) REFERENCES ServiceProviders(id) 
);

### STATEMENT

SELECT id, ip_address, subnet_mask FROM NetworkConfigurations;

SELECT Device.device_name, ServiceProviders.provider_name FROM Devices INNER JOIN ServiceProviders ON Devices.provider_id = ServiceProviders.id;

### STATEMENT

SELECT Device.device_name, ServiceProvider.provider_name, Subscription.subscription_type FROM Devices AS Device INNER JOIN ServiceProviders AS ServiceProvider ON Device.provider_id = ServiceProvider.id INNER JOIN Subscriptions AS Subscription ON ServiceProvider.id = Subscription.provider_id;

### STATEMENT

SELECT Device.device_name, Subscription.subscription_type FROM Devices AS Device INNER JOIN Subscriptions AS Subscription ON Device.provider_id = Subscription.provider_id WHERE Device.status = 'Active';

### STATEMENT

SELECT ServiceProviders.provider_name, COUNT(*) AS total_devices FROM ServiceProviders INNER JOIN Devices ON ServiceProviders.id = Devices.provider_id GROUP BY provider_name;
